channel.title: Breakaway Audio Enhancer
channel.description:
"Breakaway Audio Enhancer dramatically improves the audio experience for all PC users with the same technology as pros in the music business use to clarify and control your computer audio. Breakaway Audio Enhancer provides complete audio control over music, videos, web browsers, and games. Screaming web ads impale speakers, Hulu videos require cranking the volume up, and every media player makes favorite CD’s sound different but Breakaway Audio Enhancer changes all that. Audio from any source sounds professionally mixed with the Audio Enhancer’s automatic adjustment of volume dynamics and equalization.
Breakaway Audio Enhancer incorporates state-of-the-art dynamics processors that examines and adjusts the audio thousands of times per second. Low levels are intelligently raised and loud signals are kept under control. Audio in any media player or web browser, including MP3s, video, Internet radio, or CDs, will be digitally remastered for consistent volume level and spectral balance. Files are not scanned or modified - just improved in real-time before they hit your headphones or speakers.
With Breakaway Audio Enhancer there is no longer a need to purchase separate audio enhancement plug-ins for each of your media players. Breakaway Audio Enhancer will improve the audio for all Windows audio & video players. It is the gatekeeper for good sound between any digital audio player and your speakers. Only sweet sounds get out."
http://www.claessonedwards.com/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=46&Itemid=59
One of my favorite applications. You can change the settings to fit your music style, and it generally makes them sound a lot better. What I like a lot is you can add a minimalistic toolbar to your taskbar where you can change the volume. You should keep your system volume at max, and every game at max, while changing the Breakaway volume in the toolbar. If you have it unregistered, it will deactivate every 30 minutes, but you can just click the small button on the toolbar to reactive it immediately. I have a cracked version which I'm forbidden to link, but a lot of people like this application due to the deactivation.
My settings are:
Preset: Eruption Range: 75 Power: 50 Speed: 25 Bass Boost: +25 Bass Shape: +25

item.description:

you’re never going to get decent sub bass on headphones whatever you do, the speaker simply isn’t big enough, software can’t change physics

item.title: Breakaway Audio Enhancer
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“DEFET, post:21, topic:410755”][quote author=Mopman link=topic=512023.msg3742634#msg3742634 date=1315500933]
Just buy a subwoofer and listen to bass heavy music?
[/quote]

i have some subwoofers on my headphones and some shitty speakers, but the thing is the subwoofers make the bass sound waaay too destructive and you cannot hear the ‘treble’ of the bass, instead just a deep blop which imo sounds like shit, and my ears are really picky with music and have previously worked with equalizers a lot to try to resolve this shit, but instead all together not use subwoofers. i’m not a hardcore bass listener, more towards treble, and treble on the bass, but amplifying the bass as well.

but anyways, i don’t favor arguing about this since it’s all about your opinion. If you dislike it after trying it, then just don’t use it.[/quote]Sounds like a pretty shitty subwoofer.

Read full topic

item.title: Breakaway Audio Enhancer
item.dc:creator: @DEFET DEFET
item.description:
@DEFET wrote:

Mopman:

Just buy a subwoofer and listen to bass heavy music?

i have some subwoofers on my headphones and some shitty speakers, but the thing is the subwoofers make the bass sound waaay too destructive and you cannot hear the ‘treble’ of the bass, instead just a deep blop which imo sounds like shit, and my ears are really picky with music and have previously worked with equalizers a lot to try to resolve this shit, but instead all together not use subwoofers. i’m not a hardcore bass listener, more towards treble, and treble on the bass, but amplifying the bass as well.

but anyways, i don’t favor arguing about this since it’s all about your opinion. If you dislike it after trying it, then just don’t use it.

Read full topic

item.title: Breakaway Audio Enhancer
item.dc:creator: @DEFET DEFET
item.description:
@DEFET wrote:

niggas gotta try it first. it has no compression at all if you don’t want it to, you can modify the shit to have mad bass, or all treble, and affects all source of sound, not just an equalizer, since it reprocesses it. also it’s a taskbar toolbar that you put near your tray just to modify the volume, since the other way to alter it is to open the program in background and change it through the main window. using max volume is the best to manipulate sound with.

nowhere does it read it adds a toolbar unless you want one, and it’s not even on the browser.

If i could only record the difference, but that won’t work. I got these subwoofers, and this program made a lot more use to them. They even sound tremendous without the subwoofers.

got any dubstep or industrial shit, you pretty much need this.

used it for house party, get those shitty ass dance music up, leave the house, and come back later.

Read full topic
